title: Mum found with dead daughter in car boot after killing her to spite ex
text:
Lisa Batstone has been sentenced to life for killing her own daughter (Picture: Facebook)

A mentally disturbed Mum who killed her daughter to spite her ex-husband was found clutching the eight-year-old’s body in the boot of her car.

Canadian Lisa Batstone, 41, suffocated Teagan, eight, and bundled her body into the vehicle in 2014 before seemingly attempting to kill herself.

She had divorced husband Gabe in 2010, and the pair had become embroiled in a series of custody battles.

Mrs Batstone suffered with depression and anxiety, and had sparked concern over the state of her mind shortly before Teagan’s death.

According to The Mirror, she told her daughter that they were going to camp in their living room with makeshift beds on December 10, 2014.

Teagan Batstone was eight when her Mum smothered her (Picture: Facebook)

Gabe Gatstone had tried to win back custody of his daughter following a suicide attempt by his ex-wife (Picture: Facebook)

The next morning, she texted her ex-husband to say their daughter was ill and would be off school.

However, later that day police received a report of a car being crashed into a ditch in South Surrey, British Colombia.

When officers arrived, they found Mrs Batstone curled up in the boot holding a knife and cradling Teagan’s dead body.

She had suffocated the schoolgirl with a plastic bag and then placed the body in the car with the intention of crashing and killing herself, officers said.

The mum reportedly kept repeating ‘I just wanna die’ and said she wanted her daughter to be with Jesus.

After a two-hour interview, police concluded that she had killed Teagan to spite her ex-husband and ensure he didn’t get custody if she took her own life.

The mum was found at the side of the road after crashing her car (Picture: Facebook)

Mrs Batstone was found guilty of second-degree murder in March and sentenced to life in prison, with a minimum of 15 years, in September.

Her legal team said the mental health system had failed her and that they were disappointed with the verdict, Canadian media reports.

In court, Mrs Batstone said: ‘I’d give anything to go back and change what happened.

‘Each morning, I wake up to this excruciating nightmare and I don’t know how this can be real. I miss my sweet girl so much. I cannot believe I did what I did – but I know her death is my fault.’

Mrs Batstone had originally been given custody of her daughter, while her ex-husband moved to Ottawa, where he later remarried and had another child.

However, in 2012 she attempted to take her own life and Teagan was sent to live with her Dad.

When she was considered to have recovered, Mrs Batstone assumed custody again, while her ex-partner’s attempts to overturn the decision were turned down.

She is now appealing her sentence.

Mr Batstone reportedly said his ex-wife’s sentence had brought no closure to the family.
